intro: Struthiola virgata var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth struthiola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
